title: Baal
content: The Sun-god and the male or generative principle in nature. He was worshipped with different ideas and rites (compare the plural
) in different places: in Phoenicia as Baal (
). Baal is by some identified with Bel of Babylon and Zeus of Greece. The word
expresses the relation between lord and slave. Becoming utterly abominable from its associations, its use was abjured and
(shame) was substituted in names compounded with it. (Compare
which was also a name for Gideon.) The prophets call Baal “the Shame” (
). Ashtoreth was the goddess generally worshipped along with Baal.
